description:
Apple warns that attackers can use Siri to access sensitive user data, control nearby devices, or view recent photos without authentication. 

The post Apple Patches Major Security Flaws with iOS 18 Refresh appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Apple Patches Major Security Flaws with iOS 18 Refresh

description:
SecurityWeek will host its 2024 Attack Surface Management Summit as a fully immersive virtual event on Wednesday, September 18th.

The post SecurityWeek to Host 2024 Attack Surface Management Summit on Wednesday appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: SecurityWeek to Host 2024 Attack Surface Management Summit on Wednesday

description:
Sanctions target five individuals linked to Intellexa Consortium as the US government expands its crackdown on commercial spyware merchants.

The post US Sanctions Intellexa Executives as Surveillance Spyware Crackdown Expands appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: US Sanctions Intellexa Executives as Surveillance Spyware Crackdown Expands

description:
EasyDMARC lands venture capital funding after finding traction in the email security and authentication business.

The post EasyDMARC Lands $20M for Email Security Authentication Tech appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: EasyDMARC Lands $20M for Email Security Authentication Tech

description:
Hackers keep making claims about voter information compromise, but the US government says they’re just trying to sow distrust in the elections.

The post FBI, CISA Warn of Fake Voter Data Hacking Claims appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: FBI, CISA Warn of Fake Voter Data Hacking Claims

description:
The RansomHub ransomware gang has published 487 gigabytes of data allegedly stolen from Kawasaki Motors Europe’s systems.

The post Ransomware Group Leaks Data Allegedly Stolen From Kawasaki Motors appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Ransomware Group Leaks Data Allegedly Stolen From Kawasaki Motors

description:
Microsoft warns that a recently patched Windows vulnerability was exploited in the wild as a zero-day prior to July 2024.

The post Microsoft Says Recent Windows Vulnerability Exploited as Zero-Day appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Microsoft Says Recent Windows Vulnerability Exploited as Zero-Day

description:
Orthopedics services provider Access Sports says the data of 88,000 people was stolen by cybercriminals. 

The post 88,000 Impacted by Access Sports Data Breach Resulting From Ransomware Attack appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: 88,000 Impacted by Access Sports Data Breach Resulting From Ransomware Attack

description:
The Port of Seattle, which operates the SEA Airport, has confirmed that the August outage was the result of a ransomware attack.

The post Data Stolen in Ransomware Attack That Hit Seattle Airport appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Data Stolen in Ransomware Attack That Hit Seattle Airport

description:
SolarWinds has announced patches for a critical-severity remote code execution vulnerability in Access Rights Manager.

The post SolarWinds Patches Critical Vulnerability in Access Rights Manager appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: SolarWinds Patches Critical Vulnerability in Access Rights Manager

description:
The Ivanti Cloud Service Appliance vulnerability CVE-2024-8190 has been exploited in the wild, with attacks starting just days after disclosure.

The post Ivanti CSA Vulnerability Exploited in Attacks Days After DIsclosure appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Ivanti CSA Vulnerability Exploited in Attacks Days After DIsclosure

description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of September 16, 2024. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.
title: Industry Moves for the week of September 16, 2024 - SecurityWeek
